mdRecord.dcterms:title: Rotunda, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas (American statesman, architect, and draftsman, 1743-1826) [architect]
Mills, Robert (American architect, 1781-1855) [architect, annex, 1851-53]
White, Stanford (American architect, 1853-1906) [architect, reconstruction, 1896-1898]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Members of Jeffersonian Restoration Advisory Board in front of the construction barrier at the southwest terrace; L-R: Erin Hannigan, Scott Sottile, Connie Warnock, Maurie McInnes, Hugh Miller, Lydia DePaulo, Molly Wiley, unknown, Kim Schoenadel

Construction begun October, 1822, completed September, 1826. Annex or New Hall designed by Robert Mills 1851, built 1851-57. Burned October 27, 1895. Rebuilt to designs of Stanford White, 1896-1897. First restoration to Jefferson's design, 1973-1976; second restoration, 2012-2016. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
